slides.title: What is Prisma? üíé
slides.content:
# Type-Safe üõ°Ô∏è

Prisma is a modern ORM for Node.js/TypeScript.

It features an intuitive data model, automated migrations, and type-safety. 

It consists of **Prisma Client**, **Prisma Migrate**, and **Prisma Studio**.

slides.title: The Schema File
slides.content:
# prisma.schema üìÑ

The central source of truth.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
model User {
  id    Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  email String  @unique
  name  String?
  posts Post[]
}

model Post {
  id        Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  title     String
  authorId  Int
  author    User    @relation(fields: [authorId], references: [id])
}
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Generate Client
slides.content:
# Code Gen üè≠

`npx prisma generate`

Reads your schema and generates a custom TypeScript client tailored to your specific database structure.

Provides auto-completion for your models.

slides.title: Prisma Client
Migrations
slides.content:
# Sync DB üîÑ

`npx prisma migrate dev --name init`

Creates a SQL migration file and applies it to the database to match your schema.

slides.content:
# GUI üñ•Ô∏è

slides.title: Prisma vs TypeORM
slides.content:
# Differences ‚öñÔ∏è

- **Prisma:** Dictionary-like API, type-safe generation, separates schema from code.
- **TypeORM:** Class-based (Classes = Tables), uses decorators, closer to Hibernate.

slides.content:
# Recap: Prisma üíé

Modern & Typed.

- **Schema:** `prisma.schema`.
- **Generate:** Type-safe client.
- **Studio:** Visual editor.
- **Introspection:** Reverse engineer DB.
